intro: Rhaphiolepis pheostemonia, commonly known as the Japanese laurel. It is a flowering shrub native to Japan, characterized by its glossy evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its compact growth habit and year-round interest make it a versatile choice for landscaping.
